events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle hitting another car at a stop sign.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under auto accident due to reported vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the investigation and support customer through claim process.
Acknowledgement of the accident claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and next steps.
Customer was asked to provide the police report, photos of the damaged car, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and multiple pictures of the vehicle damage.
Investigation team began analyzing submitted documentation and reviewing car damage and accident circumstances.
Investigation completed confirming fault and extent of damage consistent with customer’s accident report.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering vehicle repairs and related costs.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with quick processing.
The claim was officially approved after confirmation of agreement on settlement terms by the customer.
Payment was issued and sent to customer’s bank account covering all approved repair costs promptly.
The accident claim case was closed successfully after payment confirmation and customer satisfaction noted.
The file for this auto accident claim was archived in the system for future reference if needed.
